reviewText: This is a very powerful film. The end always makes me tear up. It is a perfect film for teaching, especially for college anthropology classes as it can be used to talk about Shamanism, health and symbolic healing, immigration, and death customs. I especially find it useful for teaching in conjunction with Anne Fadiman's "The spirit catches you and you fall down." And even if you are not an anthropologist, these two works should be seen/viewed together in order to get the full effect from each.
